episode_summary: This episode features discussions on bizarre historical beliefs about menstruation, creative solutions to plane hijackings in the 1970s, the exhaustive study of British post-boxes, and medieval practices involving cow dung to ward off bugs.

facts.fact: In the 1920s, scientists concluded that menstruating women wilted flowers.
One proposed solution to plane hijackings in the 1970s was to build a pretend Havana airport in South Florida.
This year an organisation will finish a 40-year-long study of Britain and post-boxes, at which point it will immediately start again.
In the Middle Ages, people slept with cow dung at the foot of the bed to keep bugs away.
